name: Advanced Cell Biology

prereqs.text: ((03-240 [] at least D) or (03-320 [] at least D)) and ((03-232 [] at least D) or (03-231 [] at least D))

long_desc: This course covers fourteen topics in which significant recent advances or controversies have been reported. For each topic there is a background lecture by the instructor, student presentations of the relevant primary research articles and a general class discussion. Example topics are extracellular matrix control of normal and cancer cell cycles, force generating mechanisms in transmembrane protein translocation, signal transduction control of cell motility, and a molecular mechanism for membrane fusion.

custom_fields.key_topics: Diverse approaches in cell biology, Recent advances in cell biology
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge:
Diverse approaches in cell biology, Recent advances in cell biology

Prerequisites:
(03240 or 03320) and (03232 or 03231)
Minimum Grades:
D in 03240, D in 03320, D in 03232, D in 03231
Substitutes:
03232 for 03231
custom_fields.learning_resources: Assigned reading from primary literature and the text book Molecular Cell Biology 8th Edition by Lodish et al. (Freeman)
